about_the_game:
You're a social worker on probation. To avoid going back to jail, you need to feed the poor with food scavenged from the trash. Experiment with recipes, add anything you can — the only rule is to make it taste good.

In a world where social programs are crumbling and aid for the poor is just a formality, you take on the role of a social worker on probation. The only thing keeping you out of prison is meeting daily quotas for serving the homeless at the city soup kitchen. But the problem is, the budget has been slashed to the bone, and you have almost no resources.

Every morning, you start by raiding dumpsters, gathering scraps of food and barely edible ingredients. Your task is to turn these into meals that can satisfy your visitors. Experiment in the kitchen, combining what you find, and discover new recipes that are not only filling but surprisingly tasty.

Your goal is to feed people at any cost. Don’t hesitate to add whatever you can — chemicals, drugs, flavor enhancers. The more satisfied your guests are, the better your chances of avoiding a return to prison. But be careful: not every additive is safe, and displeasing your patrons can lead to unpredictable consequences.

You are the last line between hunger and madness in this harsh world. Can you survive in this brutal game?
